content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a simple implementation in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filtered_words = [word for word in words if first(word) == uppercase(first(word))]
    return filtered_words
end
```
This function uses list comprehension to create a new array (`filtered_words`) that only includes the words from the input `words` array where the first character of the word is a capital letter. The `uppercase` function converts the first character of the word to uppercase, and `first` retrieves the first character of the word.

You can call this function with an array of strings:
```julia
words = ["dog", "Cat", "Dog", "cat", "DOG"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println.(filtered_words)
```
This will print:
```julia
["Cat", "Dog", "DOG"]
```
